intro: Paramollugo deltoidea, commonly known as the deltoid leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive deltoid-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky or sandy soils. The species is known for its toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation in some individuals.
